biography:
Splashgirl (initiated 2003 in Oslo, Norway) is a Norwegian jazz ensemble comprising the three young musicians Andreas Stensland Løwe (piano and electronics), Jo Berger Myhre (doublebass and tone generator) and Andreas Lønmo Knudsrød (drums, percussion and sounds), playing original music.

Since 2007, Splashgirl has released four highly acclaimed albums Doors. Keys. (2007), Arbor (2009), Pressure (2011) and Field Day Rituals (2013), has played a great number of concerts in Europe, USA and Japan, and collaborated with musicians like Sidsel Endresen, Jan Bang, Eyvind Kang, Mari Kvien Brunvoll, Randall Dunn and Timothy Mason.
name: Splashgirl

With Pressure, their third album and certainly their strongest to date, the band is taking yet another giant step forward. Here the musicians are opening the doors to several new musical rooms – to the dark, dank cellar as well as to the attic – where all their forgotten memories are stored away. "Pressure" was released by Hubro in Europe on August 19th 2011. The album was mixed by drone music guru Randall Dunn, known for producing the lastest Earth records. theaudiodb.biography_en:
Splashgirl (initiated 2003 in Oslo, Norway) is a Norwegian jazz ensemble comprising the three young musicians Andreas Stensland Løwe (piano and electronics), Jo Berger Myhre (doublebass and tone generator) and Andreas Lønmo Knudsrød (drums, percussion and sounds), playing original music.

Since 2007, Splashgirl has released four highly acclaimed albums Doors. Keys. (2007), Arbor (2009), Pressure (2011) and Field Day Rituals (2013), has played a great number of concerts in Europe, USA and Japan, and collaborated with musicians like Sidsel Endresen, Jan Bang, Eyvind Kang, Mari Kvien Brunvoll, Randall Dunn and Timothy Mason.
theaudiodb.name: Splashgirl

lastfm.bio_content: Splashgirl is the innovative pianotrio consisting of Andreas Løwe (piano), Jo Berger Myhre (doublebass) and Andreas Knudsrød (drums). Regarded as one of the most exciting young instrumental bands to come out of Norway in the past few years. With Pressure, their third album and certainly their strongest to date, the band is taking yet another giant step forward. Here the musicians are opening the doors to several new musical rooms – to the dark, dank cellar as well as to the attic – where all their forgotten memories are stored away. "Pressure" was released by Hubro in Europe on August 19th 2011. The album was mixed by drone music guru Randall Dunn, known for producing the lastest Earth records. Order it here: http://www.hubromusic.com/index.php?cmd=16 Splashgirl has released three records. All are on iTunes, though the band recommends the physical objects. The second album, titled "Arbor", was released in November 2009 on Hubro/Grappa. The music is still acoustic, quite silent and not sounding like anything else. Get it here: http://www.platekompaniet.no/Musikk.aspx/CD/Splashgirl/Arbor/?id=HUBROCD2500 or here: http://www.men.musiconline.no/shop/displayAlbum.asp?id=37877 The debut from 2007 is called "Doors. Keys." Get it here: http://www.aim.musikkonline.no/shop/displayAlbum.asp?id=32424&portal=0 Official website: www.splashgirl.no Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.

Regarded as one of the most exciting young instrumental bands to come out of Norway in the past few years. With Pressure, their third album and certainly their strongest to date, the band is taking yet another giant step forward. Here the musicians are opening the doors to several new musical rooms – to the dark, dank cellar as well as to the attic – where all their forgotten memories are stored away. Read more on Last.fm

Since 2007, Splashgirl has released four highly acclaimed albums Doors. Keys.
